alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Franklin; Madison; Pickaway; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 12:57AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN CHAMPAIGN COUNTY IN WEST CENTRAL OHIO, FRANKLIN, PICKAWAY, EASTERN MADISON, SOUTHERN UNION COUNTIES IN CENTRAL OHIO AND NORTHERN ROSS COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN OHIO THROUGH 145 AM EDT... At 1257 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near New Holland, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Dublin, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Grove City, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Hilliard, Marysville, Chillicothe, Worthington, Circleville, Bexley, London, Greenfield, Jefferson, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Plain City and West Jefferson. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 75 and 110. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 85 and 120. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
